message: There's no way (AFAIK) to upload your own cert at this point (even if there were, it'd have to be SNI unless they had a dedicated-IP option). So you'll get browser warnings if you're using a CNAME; the default cert is for *.ep.io.
What carljm said, three times. We're working on custom SSL support, but because we need an IP for each domain, we need to wait until our new rack is fully provisioned.
WIll you make self signed certs available? So we can just protect our admin sessions. I'd be willing to pay a flat yearly fee $10-20+.
@citadelgrad Well, the support for custom domains will work with self-signed, and it'll be the same price (you supply your own certs anyway)
if you just want admin encryption, you could always just use the *.ep.io domain of your app for the admin
